title: What are some augmented reality app ideas? - Quora

response.answer_text: When Niantic released Pokemon Go in 2016 it opened up a new world where reality collided with virtual. No wonder tech giants like Tim cook saw opportunity in this technology - " I'm excited about Augmented Reality because unlike Virtual Reality, which closes the world out, AR allows individuals to be present in the world but hopefully allows an improvement on what's happening presently." You can get creative and apply augmented reality in many sectors. Many AR app development companies have been created because of the demand and popularity of this technology. Augmented Reality Apps can be developed in Games, Education, Print media, Marketing, Automobiles. Games - Augmented Reality became popular in the gaming industry because of games like Pokemon Go. Imagine yourself shooting a zombie in the middle of the library or running through the streets of your city for virtual treasures. Here's a game called Socio world developed by Juego Studios, a game and AR app development company. Socio world is an interesting game that revolves around creating customized avatars, texting and video chatting with your friends and Augmented Reality camera view. The fun part is when you keep a trap for your friend at a particular location.  Marketing - Recently, Ikea showed the world a new way of marketing that will catch the eye of the customers. It released an AR app where you can virtually place the furniture that fits your living room - Ikea app.  Education - Kids will remember the practical explanation of heart structure and function rather than plain text. Watching solar system come alive in a classroom has its perks. Arloon created an educational AR app called arloon plants presented on their website helps students get real insights of growing a plant. Automobiles - The German automobile manufacturer, Audi showcased its car Audi Quattro coaster to the world through AR commercial. You can ride the car by creating your own track in your living room - Audi AR app  This shows that this technology can be used in many industries. AR apps will change the way we perceive the world.

AR was first featured in movies and people thought it is only restricted to entertainment purpose which is not the case today. In fact, Best Augmented Reality Apps for iPhone and Android have made a great impact on our real life. A look at the Best Augmented Reality Apps in 2020 that presently exist in the diverse application development marketplaces and how they can be utilized to change some of the needed set-ups.  1. MondlyAR : eliminates the tedious long-term affair and brings to you the first ever AR language learning App that uses speech recognition and tries to supplement your learning experience with the human interaction 2. Ingress: The app is based on a complex sci-fi world and requires you to move around in the real world in order to capture and protect locations 3. Amikasa: virtual assistant help your style your room before you decide to buy a piece of furniture. Be it your office, garden area, hall, kitchen or bedroom with the help of your iPhone or iPad’s camera you need to simply walk around the space and place 3D models of various furniture pieces to understand how it would look in the real world. 4. Google Translate: Traveler's favorite. The app is not restricted only to spoken words. The app allows users to even translate road signs, menu and other texts on the go which are in a different language with the use of phone’s camera. 5. ROAR: This app is of great benefit for all the segments i.e. business, consumers and retailers. You can click pictures of foods and drinks and instantly get the price, ingredients used in its preparation and see reviews from people who have tasted it. Augmented Reality is to transform the world into a much better place for the coming generation. Most of the AR apps are absolutely free which leaves no scope of ignoring this evolution. We encourage everyone to make the most use of these apps today and experience a different version of reality. To explore your knowledge into AR apps, an expert in the field is Technostacks.
